usage of translations.as: compelling and effective domain - free contexts
usage of translations.from sentence: In this paper , we propose the usage of translations as compelling and effective domain - free contexts , or contexts that are always available no matter what the task domain is .

method.from sentence: In this paper , we propose a method to mitigate the possible problems when using translated sentences as context based on the following observations .

present: neural attentionbased multiple context fixing attachment ( MCFA )

present.from sentence: Based on these observations , we present a neural attentionbased multiple context fixing attachment ( MCFA ) .

is.from sentence: MCFA is a series of modules that uses all the sentence vectors ( e.g. Arabic , English , Korean , etc. ) as context to fix a sentence vector ( e.g. Korean ) .

self usability.from sentence: MCFA computes two sentence usability metrics to control the noise when fixing vectors : ( a ) self usability ? i ( a ) weighs the confidence of using sentence a in solving the task .

relative usability.from sentence: ( b ) relative usability ? r ( a , b ) weighs the confidence of using sentence a in fixing sentence b.

attached after.from sentence: ( 1 ) MCFA is attached after encoding the sentence , which makes it widely adaptable to other models .

moves.from sentence: ( 3 ) MCFA moves the vectors inside the same space , thus preserves the meaning of vector dimensions .
